Package com.tradingcards.elements.card

Class CardView

java.lang.Object
com.tradingcards.elements.card.CardView
public class CardView extends Object
Provides methods for user interaction related to trading cards, such as creating and viewing card details and collections.

  • Method Details

    • setCardName

      public String setCardName()
      Prompts the user to input the name of the card.
      Returns:
      the card name entered by the user

    • setCardRarity

      public String setCardRarity()
      Prompts the user to select the rarity of the card from a list of options. Loops until the user enters a valid option (1-4).
      Returns:
      the selected rarity as a string (e.g., "Common", "Uncommon", "Rare", "Legendary")

    • setCardVariant

      public String setCardVariant()
      Prompts the user to select the variant of the card from a list of options. Loops until the user enters a valid option (1-4).
      Returns:
      the selected variant as a string (e.g., "Normal", "Extended-art", "Full-art", "Alt-art")

    • setCardValue

      public double setCardValue()
      Prompts the user to input the base value of the card.
      Returns:
      the base value entered by the user as a double

    • setCardQuantity

      public int setCardQuantity()
      Prompts the user to input the quantity of the card.
      Returns:
      the quantity entered by the user as an int

    • displayCard

      public void displayCard(HashMap<String,CardModel> collection, String cardName)
      Displays detailed information about a specific card from the collection. If the card with the specified name exists in the collection, this method prints its name, rarity, variant (if available), value, and quantity to the standard output. If the card is not found, an error message is printed instead.
      Parameters:
      collection - the HashMap containing card names as keys and their corresponding CardModel objects as values
      cardName - the name of the card to be displayed

    • displayCollection

      public void displayCollection(HashMap<String,CardModel> collection)
      Displays the contents of a card collection in alphabetical order by card name. This method takes a HashMap<String, CardModel> where the key is the card name and the value is a CardModel object containing details such as the name and quantity. It sorts the keys (card names) alphabetically and prints each card's name and quantity to the standard output.
      Parameters:
      collection - the HashMap containing card names as keys and their corresponding CardModel objects as values
